name: 哥林多后书
description: 保罗写给哥林多教会的第二封信，强调使徒的职分和患难中的安慰

verses.zh: 奉神旨意作基督耶稣使徒的保罗，和兄弟提摩太，写信给在哥林多神的教会，并亚该亚遍处的众圣徒。
verses.en: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, To the church of God in Corinth, together with all his holy people throughout Achaia:

verses.zh: 愿恩惠、平安从神我们的父和主耶稣基督归与你们！
verses.en: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.zh: 愿颂赞归与我们主耶稣基督的父神，就是发慈悲的父，赐各样安慰的神。
verses.en: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of compassion and the God of all comfort,

verses.zh: 我们在一切患难中，他都安慰我们，叫我们能用神所赐的安慰，去安慰那遭各样患难的人。
verses.en: who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.

verses.zh: 我们既多受基督的苦楚，就靠基督多得安慰。
verses.en: For just as we share abundantly in the sufferings of Christ, so also our comfort abounds through Christ.

verses.zh: 我们受患难呢，是为叫你们得安慰，得拯救；我们得安慰呢，也是为叫你们得安慰。这安慰能叫你们忍受我们所受的那样苦楚。
verses.en: If we are distressed, it is for your comfort and salvation; if we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which produces in you patient endurance of the same sufferings we suffer.

verses.zh: 我们为你们所存的盼望是确定的，因为知道你们既是同受苦楚，也必同得安慰。
verses.en: And our hope for you is firm, because we know that just as you share in our sufferings, so also you share in our comfort.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我们不愿意你们不知道，我们从前在亚西亚遭遇苦难，被压太重，力不能胜，甚至连活命的指望都绝了。
verses.en: We do not want you to be uninformed, brothers and sisters, about the troubles we experienced in the province of Asia. We were under great pressure, far beyond our ability to endure, so that we despaired of life itself.

verses.zh: 自己心里也断定是必死的，叫我们不靠自己，只靠叫死人复活的神。
verses.en: Indeed, we felt we had received the sentence of death. But this happened that we might not rely on ourselves but on God, who raises the dead.

verses.zh: 他曾救我们脱离那极大的死亡，现在仍要救我们，并且我们指望他将来还要救我们。
verses.en: He has delivered us from such a deadly peril, and he will deliver us again. On him we have set our hope that he will continue to deliver us,

verses.zh: 你们以祈祷帮助我们，好叫许多人为我们谢恩，就是为我们因许多人所得的恩。
verses.en: as you help us by your prayers. Then many will give thanks on our behalf for the gracious favor granted us in answer to the prayers of many.

verses.zh: 我们所夸的，是自己的良心，见证我们凭着神的圣洁和诚实，在世为人，不靠人的聪明，乃靠神的恩惠，向你们更是这样。
verses.en: Now this is our boast: Our conscience testifies that we have conducted ourselves in the world, and especially in our relations with you, with integrity and godly sincerity. We have done so, relying not on worldly wisdom but on God’s grace.

verses.zh: 我们写给你们的话，并不外乎你们所念的，所认识的，我也盼望你们到底还要认识。
verses.en: For we do not write you anything you cannot read or understand. And I hope that,

verses.zh: 正如你们已经有几分认识我们，以我们夸口，好像我们在我们主耶稣的日子，以你们夸口一样。
verses.en: as you have understood us in part, you will come to understand fully that you can boast of us just as we will boast of you in the day of the Lord Jesus.

verses.zh: 我既然这样深信，就早有意到你们那里去，叫你们再得益处。
verses.en: Because I was confident of this, I wanted to visit you first so that you might benefit twice.

verses.zh: 也要从你们那里经过，往马其顿去，再从马其顿回到你们那里，叫你们给我送行往犹太去。
verses.en: I wanted to visit you on my way to Macedonia and to come back to you from Macedonia, and then to have you send me on my way to Judea.

verses.zh: 我有此意，岂是反复不定吗？我所起的意，岂是从情欲起的，叫我忽是忽非吗？
verses.en: Was I fickle when I intended to do this? Or do I make my plans in a worldly manner so that in the same breath I say both Yes and No?

verses.zh: 我指着信实的神说，我们向你们所传的道，并没有是而又非的。
verses.en: But as surely as God is faithful, our message to you is not Yes and No.

verses.zh: 因为我和西拉并提摩太，在你们中间所传神的儿子耶稣基督，总没有是而又非的，在他只有一是。
verses.en: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, whom we proclaimed among you—Sila and Timothy and I—did not become Yes and No, but in him it is always Yes.

verses.zh: 神的应许，不论有多少，在基督都是是的。所以藉着他也都是实在的，叫神因我们得荣耀。
verses.en: For no matter how many promises God has made, they are Yes in Christ. And so through him the Amen is spoken by us to the glory of God.

verses.zh: 那在基督里坚固我们和你们，并且膏我们的，就是神。
verses.en: Now it is God who makes both us and you stand firm in Christ. He anointed us,

verses.zh: 他又用印印了我们，并赐圣灵在我们心里作凭据。
verses.en: set his seal of ownership on us, and put his Spirit in our hearts as a deposit, guaranteeing what is to come.

verses.zh: 我呼吁神给我的心作见证，我没有往哥林多去是为要宽容你们。
verses.en: I call God as my witness—and I stake my life on it—that it was in order to spare you that I did not return to Corinth.

verses.zh: 我们并不是辖管你们的信心，乃是帮助你们的快乐，因为你们凭信才站立得住。
verses.en: Not that we lord it over your faith, but we work with you for your joy, because it is by faith you stand firm.

verses.zh: 我自己定了主意，再到你们那里去，必不叫你们忧愁。
verses.en: So I made up my mind that I would not make another painful visit to you.

verses.zh: 因为我若叫你们忧愁，除了我叫那忧愁的人以外，谁能叫我快乐呢？
verses.en: For if I grieve you, who is left to make me glad but you whom I have grieved?

verses.zh: 我曾把这事写给你们，恐怕我到的时候，应该叫我快乐的那些人，反倒叫我忧愁；我也深信你们众人都以我的快乐为你们的快乐。
verses.en: I wrote as I did, so that when I came I would not be distressed by those who should have made me rejoice. I had confidence in all of you, that you would all share my joy.

verses.zh: 我先前心里难过痛苦，多多的流泪，写信给你们，不是要叫你们忧愁，乃是要叫你们知道我格外爱你们。
verses.en: For I wrote you out of great distress and anguish of heart and with many tears, not to grieve you but to let you know the depth of my love for you.

verses.zh: 若有叫人忧愁的，他不是单叫我忧愁，也是叫你们众人有几分忧愁，我说几分，恐怕说得太重。
verses.en: If anyone has caused grief, he has not so much grieved me as he has grieved all of you to some extent—not to put it too severely.

verses.zh: 这样的人，受了众人的责罚也就够了。
verses.en: The punishment inflicted on him by the majority is sufficient.

verses.zh: 倒不如赦免他，安慰他，免得他忧愁太过，甚至沉沦了。
verses.en: Now instead, you ought to forgive and comfort him, so that he will not be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow.

verses.zh: 所以我劝你们，向他证实你们的爱。
verses.en: I urge you, therefore, to reaffirm your love for him.

verses.zh: 为此我先前也写信给你们，要试验你们，看你们凡事顺从不顺从。
verses.en: Another reason I wrote you was to see if you would stand the test and be obedient in everything.

verses.zh: 你们赦免谁，我也赦免谁。我若有所赦免的，是在基督面前为你们赦免的。
verses.en: Anyone you forgive, I also forgive. And what I have forgiven—if there was anything to forgive—I have forgiven in the sight of Christ for your sake,

verses.zh: 免得撒但趁着机会胜过我们，因我们并非不晓得他的诡计。
verses.en: in order that Satan might not outwit us. For we are not unaware of his schemes.

verses.zh: 我从前为基督的福音到了特罗亚，主也给我开了门。
verses.en: Now when I went to Troas to preach the gospel of Christ and found that the Lord had opened a door for me,

verses.zh: 那时因为没有遇见兄弟提多，我心里不安，便辞别那里的人往马其顿去了。
verses.en: I still had no peace of mind, because I did not find my brother Titus there. So I said goodbye to them and went on to Macedonia.

verses.zh: 感谢神，常帅领我们在基督里夸胜，并藉着我们四处显扬那因认识基督而有的香气。
verses.en: But thanks be to God, who always leads us as captives in Christ’s triumphal procession and uses us to spread the aroma of the knowledge of him everywhere.

verses.zh: 因为我们在神面前，无论在得救的人身上，或灭亡的人身上，都有基督馨香之气。
verses.en: For we are to God the pleasing aroma of Christ among those who are being saved and those who are perishing.

verses.zh: 在这等人，就作了死的香气叫他死；在那等人，就作了活的香气叫他活。这事谁能当得起呢？
verses.en: To the one we are an aroma that brings death; to the other, an aroma that brings life. And who is equal to such a task?

verses.zh: 我们不像那许多人，为利混乱神的道；乃是由诚实，由神，在神面前凭着基督讲道。
verses.en: Unlike so many, we do not peddle the word of God for profit. On the contrary, in Christ we speak before God with sincerity, as those sent from God.

verses.zh: 我们岂是又举荐自己吗？岂像别人用人的荐信给你们，或用你们的荐信给人吗？
verses.en: Are we beginning to commend ourselves again? Or do we need, like some people, letters of recommendation to you or from you?

verses.zh: 你们就是我们的荐信，写在我们的心里，被众人所知道所念诵的。
verses.en: You yourselves are our letter, written on our hearts, known and read by everyone.

verses.zh: 你们明显是基督的信，藉着我们修成的。不是用墨写的，乃是用永生神的灵写的；不是写在石版上，乃是写在心版上。
verses.en: You show that you are a letter from Christ, the result of our ministry, written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of human hearts.

verses.zh: 我们藉着基督在神面前才有这样的信心。
verses.en: Such confidence we have through Christ before God.

verses.zh: 并不是我们凭自己能承担甚么事，我们所能承担的，乃是出于神。
verses.en: Not that we are competent in ourselves to claim anything for ourselves, but our competence comes from God.

verses.zh: 他叫我们能承当这新约的执事，不是凭着字句，乃是凭着精意；因为那字句是叫人死，精意是叫人活。
verses.en: He has made us competent as ministers of a new covenant—not of the letter but of the Spirit; for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.

verses.zh: 那用字刻在石头上属死的职事尚且有荣光，甚至以色列人因摩西面上暂时的荣光，也不忍定睛看他的脸；
verses.en: Now if the ministry that brought death, which was engraved in letters on stone, came with glory, so that the Israelites could not look steadily at the face of Moses because of its glory, transitory though it was,

verses.zh: 这属灵的职事岂不更有荣光吗？
verses.en: will not the ministry of the Spirit be even more glorious?

verses.zh: 若那定罪的职事有荣光，那称义的职事荣光岂不更大吗？
verses.en: If the ministry that brought condemnation was glorious, how much more glorious is the ministry that brings righteousness!

verses.zh: 那从前有荣光的，因这极大的荣光就算不得有荣光了。
verses.en: For what was glorious has no glory now in comparison with the surpassing glory.

verses.zh: 若那废掉的有荣光，这长存的就更有荣光了。
verses.en: And if what was transitory came with glory, how much greater is the glory of that which lasts!

verses.zh: 我们既有这样的盼望，就大胆讲说，
verses.en: Therefore, since we have such a hope, we are very bold.

verses.zh: 不像摩西将帕子蒙在脸上，叫以色列人不能定睛看到那将废者的结局。
verses.en: We are not like Moses, who would put a veil over his face to prevent the Israelites from seeing the end of what was passing away.

verses.zh: 但他们的心地刚硬，直到今日诵读旧约的时候，这帕子还没有揭去。这帕子在基督里已经废去了。
verses.en: But their minds were made dull, for to this day the same veil remains when the old covenant is read. It has not been removed, because only in Christ is it taken away.

verses.zh: 直到今日，每逢诵读摩西书的时候，帕子还在他们心上。
verses.en: Even to this day when Moses is read, a veil covers their hearts.

verses.zh: 但他们的心几时归向主，帕子就几时除去了。
verses.en: But whenever anyone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.

verses.zh: 主就是那灵；主的灵在哪里，那里就得以自由。
verses.en: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

verses.zh: 我们众人既然敞着脸得以看见主的荣光，好像从镜子里返照，就变成主的形状，荣上加荣，如同从主的灵变成的。
verses.en: And we all, who with unveiled faces contemplate the Lord’s glory, are being transformed into his image with ever-increasing glory, which comes from the Lord, who is the Spirit.

verses.zh: 我们既然蒙怜悯，受了这职分，就不丧胆。
verses.en: Therefore, since through God’s mercy we have this ministry, we do not lose heart.

verses.zh: 乃将那些暗昧可耻的事弃绝了，不行诡诈，不谬讲神的道理，只将真理表明出来，好在神面前把自己荐与各人的良心。
verses.en: Rather, we have renounced secret and shameful ways; we do not use deception, nor do we distort the word of God. On the contrary, by setting forth the truth plainly we commend ourselves to everyone’s conscience in the sight of God.

verses.zh: 如果我们的福音蒙蔽，就是蒙蔽在灭亡的人身上。
verses.en: And even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing.

verses.zh: 此等不信之人，被这世界的神弄瞎了心眼，不叫基督荣耀福音的光照着他们。基督本是神的像。
verses.en: The god of this age has blinded the minds of unbelievers, so that they cannot see the light of the gospel that displays the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.

verses.zh: 我们原不是传自己，乃是传基督耶稣为主，并且自己因耶稣作你们的仆人。
verses.en: For what we preach is not ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord, and ourselves as your servants for Jesus’ sake.

verses.zh: 那吩咐光从黑暗里照出来的神，已经照在我们心里，叫我们得知神荣耀的光显在耶稣基督的面上。
verses.en: For God, who said, Let light shine out of darkness, made his light shine in our hearts to give us the light of the knowledge of God’s glory displayed in the face of Christ.

verses.zh: 我们有这宝贝放在瓦器里，要显明这莫大的能力是出于神，不是出于我们。
verses.en: But we have this treasure in jars of clay to show that this all-surpassing power is from God and not from us.

verses.zh: 我们四面受敌，却不被困住；心里作难，却不至失望；
verses.en: We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed, but not in despair;

verses.zh: 遭逼迫，却不被丢弃；打倒了，却不至死亡。
verses.en: persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed.

verses.zh: 身上常带着耶稣的死，使耶稣的生也显明在我们身上。
verses.en: We always carry around in our body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our body.

verses.zh: 因为我们这活着的人是常为耶稣被交于死地，使耶稣的生在我们这必死的身上显明出来。
verses.en: For we who are alive are always being given over to death for Jesus’ sake, so that his life may also be revealed in our mortal body.

verses.zh: 这样看来，死是在我们身上发动，生却在你们身上发动。
verses.en: So then, death is at work in us, but life is at work in you.

verses.zh: 但我们既有信心，正如经上记着说：我因信，所以如此说话。我们也信，所以也说话。
verses.en: It is written: I believed; therefore I have spoken. Since we have that same spirit of faith, we also believe and therefore speak,

verses.zh: 自己知道那叫主耶稣复活的，也必叫我们与耶稣一同复活，并且叫我们与你们一同站在他面前。
verses.en: because we know that the one who raised the Lord Jesus from the dead will also raise us with Jesus and present us with you to himself.

verses.zh: 凡事都是为你们，好叫恩惠因人多越发加增，感谢格外显多，以致荣耀归与神。
verses.en: All this is for your benefit, so that the grace that is reaching more and more people may cause thanksgiving to overflow to the glory of God.

verses.zh: 所以，我们不丧胆。外体虽然毁坏，内心却一天新似一天。
verses.en: Therefore we do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day.

verses.zh: 我们这至暂至轻的苦楚，要为我们成就极重无比永远的荣耀。
verses.en: For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory that far outweighs them all.

verses.zh: 原来我们不是顾念所见的，乃是顾念所不见的；因为所见的是暂时的，所不见的是永远的。
verses.en: So we fix our eyes not on what is seen, but on what is unseen, since what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.

verses.zh: 我们知道，我们这地上的帐棚若拆毁了，必得神所造，不是人手所造，在天上永存的房屋。
verses.en: For we know that if the earthly tent we live in is destroyed, we have a building from God, an eternal house in heaven, not built by human hands.

verses.zh: 我们在这帐棚里叹息，深想得那从天上来的房屋，好像穿上衣服。
verses.en: Meanwhile we groan, longing to be clothed instead with our heavenly dwelling,

verses.zh: 倘若穿上，被遇见的时候就不至于赤身了。
verses.en: because when we are clothed, we will not be found naked.

verses.zh: 我们在这帐棚里叹息劳苦，并非愿意脱下这个，乃是愿意穿上那个，好叫这必死的被生命吞灭了。
verses.en: For while we are in this tent, we groan and are burdened, because we do not wish to be unclothed but to be clothed instead with our heavenly dwelling, so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life.

verses.zh: 为此培植我们的就是神，他又赐给我们圣灵作凭据。
verses.en: Now the one who has fashioned us for this very purpose is God, who has given us the Spirit as a deposit, guaranteeing what is to come.

verses.zh: 所以，我们时常坦然无惧，并且晓得我们住在身内，便与主相离。
verses.en: Therefore we are always confident and know that as long as we are at home in the body we are away from the Lord.

verses.zh: 因我们行事为人是凭着信心，不是凭着眼见。
verses.en: For we live by faith, not by sight.

verses.zh: 我们坦然无惧，是更愿意离开身体与主同住。
verses.en: We would prefer to be away from the body and at home with the Lord.

verses.zh: 所以，无论是住在身内，离开身外，我们立了志向，要得主的喜悦。
verses.en: So we make it our goal to please him, whether we are at home in the body or away from it.

verses.zh: 因为我们众人必要在基督台前显露出来，叫各人按着本身所行的，或善或恶受报。
verses.en: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, so that each of us may receive what is due us for the things done while in the body, whether good or bad.

verses.zh: 我们既知道主是可畏的，所以劝人。但我们在神面前是显明的，盼望在你们的良心里也是显明的。
verses.en: Since, then, we know what it reverent fear of the Lord means, we try to persuade others. What we are is plain to God, and I hope it is also plain to your conscience.

verses.zh: 我们不是向你们再举荐自己，乃是叫你们因我们有可夸之处，好对那凭外貌不凭内心夸口的人，有言可答。
verses.en: We are not trying to commend ourselves to you again, but are giving you an opportunity to take pride in us, so that you can answer those who take pride in what is seen rather than in what is in the heart.

verses.zh: 我们若癫狂，是为神；若谨守，是为你们。
verses.en: If we are out of our mind, it is for the sake of God; if we are in our right mind, it is for you.

verses.zh: 原来基督的爱激励我们；因我们想一人既替众人死，众人就都死了。
verses.en: For Christ’s love compels us, because we are convinced that one died for all, and therefore all died.

verses.zh: 并且他替众人死，是叫那些活着的人不再为自己活，乃为替他们死而复活的主活。
verses.en: And he died for all, that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for him who died for them and was raised again.

verses.zh: 所以，我们从今以后，不凭着外貌认人了。虽然凭着外貌认过基督，如今却不再这样认他了。
verses.en: So from now on we regard no one from a worldly point of view. Though we once regarded Christ in this way, we do so no longer.

verses.zh: 若有人在基督里，他就是新造的人，旧事已过，都变成新的了。
verses.en: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!

verses.zh: 一切都是出于神，他藉着基督使我们与他和好，又将劝人与他和好的职分赐给我们。
verses.en: All this is from God, who reconciled us to himself through Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation:

verses.zh: 这就是神在基督里，叫世人与自己和好，不将他们的过犯归到他们身上，并且将这和好的道理托付了我们。
verses.en: that God was reconciling the world to himself in Christ, not counting people’s sins against them. And he has committed to us the message of reconciliation.

verses.zh: 所以，我们作基督的使者，就好像神藉我们劝你们一般。我们替基督求你们与神和好。
verses.en: We are therefore Christ’s ambassadors, as though God were making his appeal through us. We implore you on Christ’s behalf: Be reconciled to God.

verses.zh: 神使那无罪的替我们成为罪，好叫我们在祂里面成为神的义。
verses.en: God made him who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.

verses.zh: 我们与神同工的，也劝你们不可徒受他的恩典。
verses.en: As God’s co-workers we urge you not to receive God’s grace in vain.

verses.zh: 因为他说：在悦纳的时候，我应允了你；在拯救的日子，我搭救了你。看哪，现在正是悦纳的时候；现在正是拯救的日子。
verses.en: For he says, In the time of my favor I heard you, and in the day of salvation I helped you. I tell you, now is the time of God’s favor, now is the day of salvation.

verses.zh: 我们凡事都不叫人有妨碍，免得这职分被人毁谤。
verses.en: We put no stumbling block in anyone’s path, so that our ministry will not be discredited.

verses.zh: 反倒在各样的事上表明自己是神的用人，就如在许多的忍耐、患难、穷乏、困苦、
verses.en: Rather, as servants of God we commend ourselves in every way: in great endurance; in troubles, hardships and distresses;

verses.zh: 鞭打、监禁、扰乱、勤劳、儆醒、不食、
verses.en: in beatings, imprisonments and riots; in hard work, sleepless nights and hunger;

verses.zh: 廉洁、知识、恒忍、恩慈、圣灵的感化、无伪的爱心、
verses.en: in purity, understanding, patience and kindness; in the Holy Spirit and in sincere love;

verses.zh: 真道的讲论、大能；仁义的兵器在左在右。
verses.en: in truthful speech and in the power of God; with weapons of righteousness in the right hand and in the left;

verses.zh: 荣耀羞辱，恶名美名；似乎是诱惑人的，却是诚实的；
verses.en: through glory and dishonor, bad report and good report; genuine, yet regarded as impostors;

verses.zh: 似乎不为人所知，却是人所共知的；似乎要死，却是活着的；似乎受责罚，却是不至丧命的；
verses.en: known, yet regarded as unknown; dying, and yet we live on; beaten, and yet not killed;

verses.zh: 似乎忧愁，却是常常快乐的；似乎贫穷，却是叫许多人富足的；似乎一无所有，却是样样都有的。
verses.en: sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; poor, yet making many rich; having nothing, and yet possessing everything.

verses.zh: 哥林多人哪，我们向你们，口是张开的，心是宽宏的。
verses.en: We have spoken freely to you, Corinthians; our heart is wide open to you.

verses.zh: 你们在我们的心里狭窄，我们在你们的心肠里也狭窄。
verses.en: We are not withholding our affection from you, but you are withholding yours from us.

verses.zh: 你们也要照样用宽宏的心报答我。我这话正像对自己的儿女说的。
verses.en: As a fair exchange—I speak as to my children—open wide your hearts also.

verses.zh: 你们和不信的原不相配，不要同负一轭。义和不义有甚么相交呢？光明和黑暗有甚么相通呢？
verses.en: Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness?

verses.zh: 基督和彼列有甚么相和呢？信主的和不信主的有甚么相干呢？
verses.en: What harmony is there between Christ and Belial? Or what does a believer have in common with an unbeliever?

verses.zh: 神的殿和偶像有甚么相同呢？因为我们是永生神的殿，就如神曾说：我要在他们中间居住，在他们中间来往；我要作他们的神，他们要作我的子民。
verses.en: What agreement is there between the temple of God and idols? For we are the temple of the living God. As God has said: I will live with them and walk among them, and I will be their God, and they will be my people.

verses.zh: 又说：你们务要从他们中间出来，与他们分别，不要沾不洁净的物，我就收纳你们。
verses.en: Therefore, Come out from them and be separate, says the Lord. Touch no unclean thing, and I will receive you.

verses.zh: 我要作你们的父，你们要作我的儿女。万军之主说。
verses.en: And, I will be a Father to you, and you will be my sons and daughters, says the Lord Almighty.

verses.zh: 亲爱的弟兄啊，我们既有这等应许，就当洁净自己，除去身体灵魂一切的污秽，敬畏神，得以成圣。
verses.en: Therefore, since we have these promises, dear friends, let us purify ourselves from everything that contaminates body and spirit, perfecting holiness out of reverence for God.

verses.zh: 你们要心地宽大收纳我们。我们未曾亏负谁，未曾败坏谁，未曾占谁的便宜。
verses.en: Make room for us in your hearts. We have wronged no one, we have corrupted no one, we have exploited no one.

verses.zh: 我说这话，不是要定你们的罪。我已经说过，你们常在我们心里，情愿与你们同生同死。
verses.en: I do not say this to condemn you; I have said before that you have such a place in our hearts that we would live or die with you.

verses.zh: 我大大的放胆向你们说话。我因你们多多夸口，满得安慰。我们在一切患难中分外的快乐。
verses.en: I have spoken to you with great frankness; I take great pride in you. I am greatly encouraged; in all our troubles my joy knows no bounds.

verses.zh: 我们从前就是到了马其顿的时候，身体也不得安宁，周围遭患难，外有争战，内有惧怕。
verses.en: For when we came into Macedonia, we had no rest, but we were harassed at every turn—conflicts on the outside, fears within.

verses.zh: 但那安慰丧胆之人的神，藉着提多来安慰了我们。
verses.en: But God, who comforts the downcast, comforted us by the coming of Titus,

verses.zh: 不但藉着他来，也藉着他从你们所得的安慰，安慰了我们。他把你们的想念、你们的哀恸、你们为我的热心，都告诉了我，叫我更加欢喜。
verses.en: and not only by his coming but also by the comfort you had given him. He told us about your longing for me, your deep sorrow, your ardent concern for me, so that my joy was greater than ever.

verses.zh: 我先前写信叫你们忧愁，我后来虽然懊悔，如今却不懊悔，因我知道那信叫你们忧愁不过是暂时的。
verses.en: Even if I caused you sorrow by my letter, I do not regret it. Though I did regret it—I see that my letter hurt you, but only for a little while—

verses.zh: 如今我欢喜，不是因你们忧愁，乃因你们从忧愁中生出懊悔来。你们依着神的意思忧愁，凡事就不至于因我们受亏损了。
verses.en: yet now I am happy, not because you were made sorry, but because your sorrow led you to repentance. For you became sorrowful as God intended and so were not harmed in any way by us.

verses.zh: 因为依着神的意思忧愁，就生出没有后悔的懊悔来，以致得救；但世俗的忧愁是叫人死。
verses.en: Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death.

verses.zh: 你们依着神的意思忧愁，从此就生出何等的殷勤、自诉、自恨、恐惧、想念、热心、责罚。在这一切事上，你们都表明自己是洁净的。
verses.en: See what this godly sorrow has produced in you: what earnestness, what eagerness to clear yourselves, what indignation, what alarm, what longing, what concern, what readiness to see justice done. At every point you have proved yourselves to be innocent in this matter.

verses.zh: 我虽然从前写信给你们，却不是为那亏负人的，也不是为那受亏负的，乃是要在神面前，把你们顾念我们的热心表明出来。
verses.en: So even though I wrote to you, it was neither on account of the one who did the wrong nor on account of the one who suffered the wrong. Instead, it was in order that in the sight of God you might see for yourselves how devoted to us you are.

verses.zh: 因此，我们得了安慰，并且在安慰之中，更得欢喜的是，你们众人的快乐。
verses.en: By all this we are encouraged. In addition to our own encouragement, we were especially delighted to see how happy Titus was, because his spirit has been refreshed by all of you.

verses.zh: 我若对提多夸奖了你们甚么，也是没有惭愧的。因为我对提多夸奖你们的话句句都是真的。
verses.en: I had boasted to him about you, and you have not embarrassed me. But just as everything we said to you was true, so our boasting about you to Titus has proved to be true as well.

verses.zh: 并且他想起你们众人的顺服，是怎样恐惧战兢的接待他，他对你们的爱越发深了。
verses.en: And his affection for you is all the greater when he remembers that you were all obedient, receiving him with fear and trembling.

verses.zh: 我如今欢喜，能在凡事上为你们放心。
verses.en: I am glad I can have complete confidence in you.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我把神赐给马其顿众教会的恩告诉你们。
verses.en: And now, brothers and sisters, we want you to know about the grace that God has given the Macedonian churches.

verses.zh: 他们虽然在患难中受大试炼的时候，仍有满足的快乐，在极深的贫穷之中，还格外显出他们乐捐的厚恩。
verses.en: In the midst of a very severe trial, their overflowing joy and their extreme poverty welled up in rich generosity.

verses.zh: 我可以证明，他们是按着力量，而且也过了力量，自己甘心乐捐的。
verses.en: For I testify that they gave as much as they were able, and even beyond their ability. Entirely on their own,

verses.zh: 再三的求我们，准他们在这供给圣徒的恩情上有分。
verses.en: they urgently pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in this service to the Lord’s people.

verses.zh: 并且他们所作的，不但照我们所想望的，更照神的旨意先把自己献给主，也归附了我们。
verses.en: And they exceeded our expectations: They gave themselves first of all to the Lord, and then by the God’s will also to us.

verses.zh: 因此，我劝提多，既然在你们中间开了这善工，就当成全这事。
verses.en: So we urged Titus, just as he had earlier made a beginning, to bring also to completion this act of grace on your part.

verses.zh: 你们既然在信心、口才、知识、热心，和待我们的爱心上，都格外显出满足来，就当在这慈惠的事上也格外显出满足来。
verses.en: But since you excel in everything—in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in complete earnestness and in the love we have kindled in you—see that you also excel in this grace of giving.

verses.zh: 我说这话，不是吩咐你们，乃是藉着别人的热心试验你们爱心的实在。
verses.en: I am not commanding you, but I want to test the sincerity of your love by comparing it with the earnestness of others.

verses.zh: 你们知道我们主耶稣基督的恩典：他本来富足，却为你们成了贫穷，叫你们因他的贫穷，可以成为富足。
verses.en: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sake he became poor, so that you through his poverty might become rich.

verses.zh: 我在这事上把我的意见告诉你们，是与你们有益。因为你们下手作这事，而且起念作这事，已经有一年了。
verses.en: And here is my judgment about what is best for you in this matter. Last year you were the first not only to give but also to have the desire to do so.

verses.zh: 如今就当成全这事。既有愿做的心，也当照你们所有的去成全。
verses.en: Now finish the work, so that your eager willingness to do it may be matched by your completion of it, according to your means.

verses.zh: 因为人若有愿做的心，必蒙悦纳，乃是照他所有的，并不是照他所无的。
verses.en: For if the willingness is there, the gift is acceptable according to what one has, not according to what one does not have.

verses.zh: 我原不是要别人轻省，你们重担，乃要均平。
verses.en: Our desire is not that others might be relieved while you are hard pressed, but that there might be equality.

verses.zh: 在今时你们的宽裕可以补他们的不足，使来日他们的宽裕也可以补你们的不足，这就均平了。
verses.en: At the present time your plenty will supply what they need, so that in turn their plenty will supply what you need. The goal is equality,

verses.zh: 如经上所记：多收的也没有余，少收的也没有缺。
verses.en: as it is written: The one who gathered much did not have too much, and the one who gathered little did not have too little.

verses.zh: 多谢神，感动提多的心，叫他待你们殷勤，像我一样。
verses.en: Thanks be to God, who put into the heart of Titus the same concern I have for you.

verses.zh: 他固然是听了我的劝，但自己更是热心，情愿往你们那里去。
verses.en: For Titus not only welcomed our appeal, but he is coming to you with much enthusiasm and on his own initiative.

verses.zh: 我们还打发一位兄弟和他同去。这人在福音上得了众教会的称赞。
verses.en: And we are sending along with him the brother who is praised by all the churches for his service to the gospel.

verses.zh: 不但这样，他也被众教会挑选和我们同行，把所托与我们的这捐资送到了，可以荣耀主，又表明我们乐意的心。
verses.en: What is more, he was chosen by the churches to accompany us as we carry the offering, which we administer in order to honor the Lord himself and to show our eagerness to help.

verses.zh: 这就免得有人因我们经手的这厚资毁谤我们。
verses.en: We want to avoid any criticism of the way we administer this liberal gift.

verses.zh: 因为我们留心行光明的事，不但在主面前，就在人面前也是如此。
verses.en: For we are taking pains to do what is right, not only in the eyes of the Lord but also in the eyes of man.

verses.zh: 我们又打发一位兄弟同去。这人的热心，我们在许多事上屡次试验过。现在他因为深信你们，就更加热心了。
verses.en: In addition, we are sending with them our brother who has often proved to us in many ways that he is zealous, and now even more so because of his great confidence in you.

verses.zh: 论到提多，他是我的同伴，一同为你们劳碌的。论到那两位兄弟，他们是众教会的使者，是基督的荣耀。
verses.en: As for Titus, he is my partner and co-worker among you; as for our brothers, they are representatives of the churches and an honor to Christ.

verses.zh: 所以，你们务要在众教会面前显明你们爱心的凭据，和我们所夸奖你们的凭据。
verses.en: Therefore show these men the proof of your love and the reason for our pride in you, so that the churches can see it.

verses.zh: 论到供给圣徒的事，我不必写信给你们。
verses.en: There is no need for me to write to you about this service to the Lord’s people.

verses.zh: 因为我知道你们乐意的心，常对马其顿人夸奖你们，说亚该亚人预备好了，自从去年以来，并且你们的热心激动了许多人。
verses.en: For I know your eagerness to help, and I have been boasting about it to the Macedonians, telling them that since last year you in Achaia were ready to give; and your enthusiasm has stirred most of them to action.

verses.zh: 但我打发那几位兄弟去，要叫你们照我的话预备妥当，免得我们在这事上夸奖你们的话落了空。
verses.en: But I am sending the brothers in order that our boasting about you in this matter should not prove hollow, but that you may be ready, as I said you would be.

verses.zh: 万一有马其顿人与我同去，见你们没有预备，就叫我们所确信的，反成了羞愧；你们羞愧，更不用说了。
verses.en: For if any Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we—not to say anything about you—would be ashamed of having been so confident.

verses.zh: 因此，我想不得不求那几位兄弟先到你们那里去，把你们预先许的捐资预备妥当，就显出你们所捐的，是出于乐意，不是出于勉强。
verses.en: So I thought it necessary to urge the brothers to visit you in advance and finish the arrangements for the generous gift you had promised. Then it will be ready as a generous gift, not as one grudgingly given.

verses.zh: 少种的少收，多种的多收，这话是真的。
verses.en: Remember this: Whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows generously will also reap generously.

verses.zh: 各人要随本心所酌定的，不要作难，不要勉强，因为捐得乐意的人是神所喜爱的。
verses.en: Each of you should give what you have decided in your heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.

verses.zh: 神能将各样的恩惠多多的加给你们，使你们凡事常常充足，能多行各样善事。
verses.en: And God is able to bless you abundantly, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work.

verses.zh: 如经上所记：他施舍钱财，周济贫穷，他的仁义存到永远。
verses.en: As it is written: They have freely scattered their gifts to the poor; their righteousness endures forever.

verses.zh: 那赐种给撒种的，赐粮给人吃的，必多多加给你们种子，使你们仁义的果子增加。
verses.en: Now he who supplies seed to the sower and bread for eating will also supply and increase your store of seed and will enlarge the harvest of your righteousness.

verses.zh: 你们凡事富足，可以多多施舍，就藉着我们使感谢归于神。
verses.en: You will be enriched in every way so that you can be generous on every occasion, and through us your generosity will result in thanksgiving to God.

verses.zh: 因为办这供给的事，不但补圣徒的缺乏，而且叫许多人越发感谢神。
verses.en: This service that you perform is not only supplying the needs of the Lord’s people but is also overflowing in many expressions of thanks to God.

verses.zh: 他们因这供给的事 experimentally 试验你们，且见你们承认基督的福音，有忠心，又甘心捐助他们和众人，就荣耀神。
verses.en: Because of the service by which you have proved yourselves, others will praise God for the obedience that accompanies your confession of the gospel of Christ, and for your generosity in sharing with them and with everyone else.

verses.zh: 他们也因神极大的恩赐，切切的想念你们，为你们祈祷。
verses.en: And in their prayers for you their hearts will go out to you, because of the surpassing grace God has given you.

verses.zh: 感谢神，因他有说不尽的恩赐。
verses.en: Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift!

verses.zh: 我保罗，就是与你们见面的时候是谦卑的，不在你们那里的时候向你们是勇敢的，如今亲自藉着基督的温柔和平劝你们。
verses.en: By the humility and gentleness of Christ, I appeal to you—I, Paul, who when I am face-to-face with you am lowly among you, but when I am away am bold toward you.

verses.zh: 我求你们，我不在那里的时候，不要叫我勇敢起来，藉着我所想定的，要攻击你们。
verses.en: I beg you that when I come I may not have to be as bold as I expect to be toward some people who think that we live by the standards of this world.

verses.zh: 因为我们虽然在世上行事为人，却不是凭着血气争战。
verses.en: For though we live in the world, we do not wage war as the world does.

verses.zh: 我们争战的兵器本不是属血气的，乃是在神面前有能力，可以攻破坚固的营垒。
verses.en: The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world. On the contrary, they have divine power to demolish strongholds.

verses.zh: 将各样的计谋，各样拦阻人认识神的那些自高之事，一概攻破了，又将人所有的心意夺回，使他都顺服基督。
verses.en: We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God, and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ.

verses.zh: 并且我已经预备好了，等你们十分顺服的时候，要责罚那一切不顺服的人。
verses.en: And we will be ready to punish every act of disobedience, once your obedience is complete.

verses.zh: 你们是看眼前的吗？若有人自信是属基督的，他要再想想，他如何属基督，我们也是如何属基督的。
verses.en: You are judging by appearances. If anyone is confident that they belong to Christ, they should consider again that we belong to Christ just as much as they do.

verses.zh: 主赐给我们权柄，是要造就你们，并不是要败坏你们，我就是为此稍为夸口，也不至于惭愧。
verses.en: So even if I boast somewhat freely about the authority the Lord gave us for building you up rather than tearing you down, I will not be ashamed of it.

verses.zh: 我不要显得好像要藉着书信威吓你们。
verses.en: I do not want to seem to be trying to frighten you with my letters.

verses.zh: 因为有人说：他的书信沉重严厉，面貌却柔弱，言语又卑贱不堪。
verses.en: For some say, His letters are weighty and forceful, but in person he is unimpressive and his speaking amounts to nothing.

verses.zh: 这样的人当想，我们不在那里的时候，书信如何，人到了那里，行事也必如何。
verses.en: Such people should realize that what we are in our letters when we are absent, we will be in our actions when we are present.

verses.zh: 因为我们不敢将自己和那自荐的人同列相比。他们用自己度量自己，用自己比较自己，乃是不通达的。
verses.en: We do not dare to classify or compare ourselves with some who commend themselves. When they measure themselves by themselves and compare themselves with themselves, they are not wise.

verses.zh: 我们不愿意分外夸口，只要照神所量给我们的界限夸口。
verses.en: We, however, will not boast beyond proper limits, but will confine our boasting to the sphere of service God himself has assigned to us, a sphere that also includes you.

verses.zh: 我们并非过了我们的界限，好像没有到你们那里，因为我们早到了你们那里，传了基督的福音。
verses.en: We are not going too far in our boasting, as would be the case if we had not come to you, for we did get as far as you with the gospel of Christ.

verses.zh: 我们不仗着别人所劳碌的，分外夸口，但指望你们信心增长的时候，所量给我们的界限，就可以因着你们更加开展。
verses.en: Neither do we go beyond our limits by boasting of work done by others. Our hope is that, as your faith continues to grow, our sphere of activity among you will greatly expand,

verses.zh: 得以将福音传到你们以外的地方，并不是在别人界限之内，藉着他现成的事夸口。
verses.en: so that we can preach the gospel in the regions beyond you. For we do not want to boast about work already done in someone else’s territory.

verses.zh: 但夸口的，当指着主夸口。
verses.en: But, Let the one who boasts boast in the Lord.

verses.zh: 因为蒙悦纳的，不是自己称许的，乃是主所称许的。
verses.en: For it is not the one who commends himself who is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends.

verses.zh: 但愿你们宽容我这一点愚妄，其实你们原是宽容我的。
verses.en: I hope you will put up with me in a little foolishness. Yes, please put up with me!

verses.zh: 我为你们起的愤恨，原是神那样的愤恨。因为我曾把你们许配一个丈夫，要献你们作纯洁的童女，献给基督。
verses.en: I am jealous for you with a godly jealousy. I promised you to one husband, to Christ, so that I might present you as a pure virgin to him.

verses.zh: 我只怕你们的心或偏于邪，失去那向基督所存纯一清洁的心，就像蛇用诡诈诱惑了夏娃一样。
verses.en: But I am afraid that just as Eve was deceived by the serpent’s cunning, your minds may somehow be led astray from your sincere and pure devotion to Christ.

verses.zh: 假如有人来另传一个耶稣，不是我们所传过的；或者你们另受一个灵，不是你们所受过的；或者另得一个福音，不是你们所得着的，你们容让他也就罢了。
verses.en: For if someone comes to you and preaches a Jesus other than the Jesus we preached, or if you receive a different spirit from the Spirit you received, or a different gospel from the one you accepted, you put up with it easily enough.

verses.zh: 但我想，我一点不在那些最大的使徒以下。
verses.en: I do not think I am in the least inferior to those super-apostles.

verses.zh: 我的言语虽然粗俗，我的知识却不粗俗。这是我们在凡事上向你们众人显明的。
verses.en: I may indeed be untrained as a speaker, but I do have knowledge. We have made this perfectly clear to you in every way.

verses.zh: 我因为白白传神的福音给你们，就自居卑微，叫你们高升，这算是我犯罪吗？
verses.en: Was it a sin for me to lower myself in order to elevate you by preaching the gospel of God to you free of charge?

verses.zh: 我亏负了别的教会，向他们取了工价来给你们效力。
verses.en: I robbed other churches by receiving support from them so that I could serve you.

verses.zh: 我在你们那里缺乏的时候，并没有累着你们一个人；因我所缺乏的，那从马其顿来的弟兄们都补足了。我凡事谨守，后来也必谨守，总不至于累着你们。
verses.en: And when I was with you and needed something, I was not a burden to anyone, for the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied what I needed. I have kept myself from being a burden to you in any way, and will continue to do so.

verses.zh: 既有基督的诚实在我里面，就无人能在亚该亚一带地方阻挡我这自夸。
verses.en: As surely as the truth of Christ is in me, nobody in the regions of Achaia will stop this boasting of mine.

verses.zh: 为甚么呢？是因我不爱你们吗？神知道我是爱你们的。
verses.en: Why? Because I do not love you? God knows I do!

verses.zh: 我现在所作的，后来还要作，为要断绝那些寻机会人的机会，使他们在所夸的事上也不过与我们一样。
verses.en: And I will keep on doing what I am doing in order to cut the ground from under those who want an opportunity to be considered equal with us in the things they boast about.

verses.zh: 那等人是假使徒，行事诡诈，装作基督使徒的模样。
verses.en: For such people are false apostles, deceitful workmen, masquerading as apostles of Christ.

verses.zh: 这也不足为怪，因为连撒但也装作光明的天使。
verses.en: And no wonder, for Satan himself masquerades as an angel of light.

verses.zh: 所以，他的差役也装作仁义的差役，这等人的结局必然照着他们的行为。
verses.en: It is not surprising, then, if his servants also masquerade as servants of righteousness. Their end will be what their actions deserve.

verses.zh: 我再说，人不可把我看作愚妄的；纵然如此，也要把我当作愚妄的人接纳，叫我可以略略自夸。
verses.en: I repeat: Let no one take me for a fool. But if you do, then tolerate me just as you would a fool, so that I may do a little boasting.

verses.zh: 我说这话，不是照着主说的，乃像愚妄人，在这自夸的事上大胆说话。
verses.en: In this self-confident boasting I am not talking as the Lord would, but as a fool.

verses.zh: 既有好些人凭着血气自夸，我也要自夸了。
verses.en: Since many are boasting in the way the world does, I too will boast.

verses.zh: 你们既是精明人，就能甘心忍耐愚妄人。
verses.en: You gladly put up with fools since you are so wise!

verses.zh: 假若有人强迫你们作奴仆，或侵吞你们，或掳掠你们，或侮慢你们，或打你们的脸，你们都能忍耐他。
verses.en: In fact, you even put up with anyone who enslaves you or exploits you or takes advantage of you or puts on airs or slaps you in the face.

verses.zh: 我说这话是羞辱自己，好像我们从前是软弱的。然而，人在何事上大胆，（我说句愚妄话，）我也大胆了。
verses.en: To my shame I admit that we were too weak for that! Whatever anyone else dares to boast about—I am speaking as a fool—I also dare to boast about.

verses.zh: 他们是希伯来人吗？我也是。他们是以色列人吗？我也是。他们是亚伯拉罕的后裔吗？我也是。
verses.en: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they Abraham’s descendants? So am I.

verses.zh: 他们是基督的仆人吗？（我说句狂话，）我更是。我比他们多受劳苦，多下监牢，受鞭打是过重的，冒死是屡次的。
verses.en: Are they servants of Christ? (I am out of my mind to talk like this.) I am more. I have worked much harder, been in prison more frequently, been flogged more severely, and been exposed to death again and again.

verses.zh: 被犹太人鞭打五次，每次四十减去一下。
verses.en: Five times I received from the Jews the forty lashes minus one.

verses.zh: 被棍打了三次，被石头打了一次，遇着船坏三次，一昼一夜在深海里。
verses.en: Three times I was beaten with rods, once I was pelted with stones, three times I was shipwrecked, I spent a night and a day in the open sea,

verses.zh: 又屡次行远路，遭江河的危险、盗贼的危险、同族的危险、外邦人的危险、城里的危险、旷野的危险、海中的危险、假弟兄的危险。
verses.en: I have been constantly on the move. I have been in danger from rivers, in danger from bandits, in danger from my fellow Jews, in danger from Gentiles; in danger in the city, in danger in the country, in danger at sea; and in danger from false believers.

verses.zh: 受劳碌、受困苦，多次不得睡，又饥又渴，多次不得食，受寒冷，又赤身露体。
verses.en: I have labored and toiled and have often gone without sleep; I have known hunger and thirst and have often gone without food; I have been cold and naked.

verses.zh: 除了这些外的事，还有为众教会挂心的事，天天压在我身上。
verses.en: Besides everything else, I face daily the pressure of my concern for all the churches.

verses.zh: 有谁软弱，我不软弱呢？有谁跌倒，我不焦急呢？
verses.en: Who is weak, and I do not feel weak? Who is led into sin, and I do not inwardly burn?

verses.zh: 我若必须自夸，就夸那关乎我软弱的事便了。
verses.en: If I must boast, I will boast of the things that show my weakness.

verses.zh: 那永远可称颂之主耶稣的父神知道我不说谎。
verses.en: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus, who is to be praised forever, knows that I am not lying.

verses.zh: 在大马士革，亚哩达王手下的提督，把守大马士革城，要捉拿我。
verses.en: In Damascus the governor under King Aretas had the city of the Damascenes guarded in order to arrest me.

verses.zh: 我就从窗户里，在筐子里被人缒下城墙，脱离了他的手。
verses.en: But I was lowered in a basket from a window in the wall and slipped through his hands.

verses.zh: 自夸固然无益，但我是不得已的。如今我要说到主的显现和启示。
verses.en: I must go on boasting. Although there is nothing to be gained, I will go on to visions and revelations from the Lord.

verses.zh: 我认得一个在基督里的人，他前十四年被提到第三层天上去。或在身内，我不知道；或在身外，我也不知道；只有神知道。
verses.en: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago was caught up to the third heaven. Whether it was in the body or out of the body I do not know—God knows.

verses.zh: 我认得这人，或在身内，或在身外，我都不知道；只有神知道。
verses.en: And I know that this man—whether in the body or apart from the body I do not know, but God knows—

verses.zh: 他被提到乐园里，听见隐秘的言语，是人不可说的。
verses.en: was caught up to paradise and heard inexpressible things, things that no one is permitted to tell.

verses.zh: 为这人，我要自夸；但是为我自己，除了我的软弱以外，我并不自夸。
verses.en: I will boast about a man like that, but I will not boast about myself, except about my weaknesses.

verses.zh: 我就是愿意自夸，也不算狂，因为我要说实话；只是我禁止不说，恐怕有人把我看高了，过于他在我身上所看见所听见我的。
verses.en: Even if I should choose to boast, I would not be a fool, because I would be speaking the truth. But I refrain, so no one will think more of me than is warranted by what I do or say,

verses.zh: 又恐怕我因所得的启示甚大，就过于自高，所以有一根刺加在我肉体上，就是撒但的差役，要攻击我，免得我过于自高。
verses.en: or because of these surpassingly great revelations. Therefore, in order to keep me from becoming conceited, I was given a thorn in my flesh, a messenger of Satan, to torment me.

verses.zh: 为这事，我三次求过主，叫这刺离开我。
verses.en: Three times I pleaded with the Lord to take it away from me.

verses.zh: 他对我说：我的恩典够你用的，因为我的能力是在人的软弱上显得完全。所以，我更喜欢夸自己的软弱，好叫基督的能力覆庇我。
verses.en: But he said to me, My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness. Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ’s power may rest on me.

verses.zh: 我为基督的缘故，就以软弱、凌辱、急难、逼迫、困苦为可喜乐的；因我什么时候软弱，什么时候就刚强了。
verses.en: That is why, for Christ’s sake, I delight in weaknesses, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak, then I am strong.

verses.zh: 我成了愚妄人，是被你们逼的。我本该被你们称许才是。我虽算不得甚么，却没有一件事在那些最大的使徒以下。
verses.en: I have made a fool of myself, but you drove me to it. I ought to have been commended by you, for I am not in the least inferior to the super-apostles, even though I am nothing.

verses.zh: 我在你们中间，用百般的忍耐，藉着神迹、奇事、异能，显出使徒的凭据来。
verses.en: I persevered in demonstrating among you the marks of a true apostle, including signs, wonders and miracles.

verses.zh: 除了我不累着你们这一件事，你们还有甚么事不及别的教会呢？这不公之处，求你们饶恕我吧。
verses.en: How were you inferior to the other churches, except that I was never a burden to you? Forgive me this wrong!

verses.zh: 如今，我第三次预备到你们那里去，也必不累着你们，因我所求的是你们，不是你们的财物。儿女不该为父母积财，父母该为儿女积财。
verses.en: Now I am ready to visit you for the third time, and I will not be a burden to you, because what I want is not your possessions but you. After all, children should not have to save up for their parents, but parents for their children.

verses.zh: 我甘心乐意为你们的灵魂费财费力。难道我越发爱你们，就越发少得你们的爱吗？
verses.en: So I will very gladly spend for you everything I have and expend myself as well. If I love you more, will you love me less?

verses.zh: 罢了，我自己并没有累着你们，你们却有人说，我是用诡诈待你们。
verses.en: Be that as it may, I have not been a burden to you. Yet, crafty fellow that I am, I caught you by trickery!

verses.zh: 我所差到你们那里去的人，我藉着他们一个人占过你们的便宜吗？
verses.en: Did I exploit you through any of the men I sent to you?

verses.zh: 我劝了提多到你们那里去，又差了一个兄弟与他同去。提多占过你们的便宜吗？我们行事，不同是一个灵吗？不同是一个脚踪吗？
verses.en: I urged Titus to go to you and I sent our brother with him. Did Titus exploit you? Did we not walk in the same footsteps by the same Spirit?

verses.zh: 你们到如今，还想我们是向你们分诉。我们本是在基督里当着神面前说话。亲爱的弟兄啊，一切的事都是为造就你们。
verses.en: Have you been thinking all along that we have been defending ourselves to you? We have been speaking in the sight of God as those in Christ; and everything we do, dear friends, is for your strengthening.

verses.zh: 我怕我再来的时候，见你们不合我所想望的，神也见我不合他所想望的。又怕有分争、嫉妒、恼怒、结党、毁谤、谗言、狂傲、混乱的事。
verses.en: For I am afraid that when I come I may not find you as I want you to be, and you may not find me as you want me to be. I fear that there may be discord, jealousy, fits of rage, selfish ambition, slander, gossip, arrogance and disorder.

verses.zh: 且怕我来的时候，我的神叫我在你们面前惭愧，又因许多人从前犯罪，行污秽、奸淫、邪荡的事，不肯悔改，我就忧愁。
verses.en: I am afraid that when I come again my God will humble me before you, and I will be grieved over many who have sinned earlier and have not repented of the impurity, sexual sin and debauchery in which they have indulged.

verses.zh: 这是第三次我要到你们那里去。凭两三个人的口作见证，句句都要定准。
verses.en: This will be my third visit to you. Every matter must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.

verses.zh: 我从前说过，如今不在你们那里又说，正如我第二次见你们的时候所说的一样，就是对那犯了罪的和其余的人说，我若再来，必不宽容。
verses.en: I already gave you a warning when I was with you the second time. I now repeat it while absent: On my return I will not spare those who sinned earlier or any of the others,

verses.zh: 你们既然寻求基督在我里面说话的凭据，我必不宽容。因为基督在你们身上，不是软弱的，在你们里面是有大能的。
verses.en: since you are demanding proof that Christ is speaking through me. He is not weak in dealing with you, but is powerful among you.

verses.zh: 他因软弱被钉在十字架上，却因神的大能仍然活着。我们也是这样同他软弱，但因神向你们所显的大能，也必与他同活。
verses.en: For to be sure, he was crucified in weakness, yet he lives by God’s power. Likewise, we are weak in him, yet by God’s power we will live with him in our dealing with you.

verses.zh: 你们总要自己省察有信心没有，也要自己试验。岂不知你们若不是可弃绝的，就有耶稣基督在你们心里吗？
verses.en: Examine yourselves to see whether you are in the faith; test yourselves. Do you not realize that Christ Jesus is in you—unless, of course, you fail the test?

verses.zh: 我希望你们晓得，我们不是可弃绝的人。
verses.en: And I trust that you will discover that we have not failed the test.

verses.zh: 我们求神，叫你们一件恶事都不作。这不是要显明我们是蒙悦纳的，乃是要你们行善，我们虽算为不蒙悦纳的，也无妨。
verses.en: Now we pray to God that you will not do anything wrong—not so that people will see that we have stood the test but so that you will do what is right even though we may seem to have failed.

verses.zh: 我们凡事不能敌挡真理，只能扶助真理。
verses.en: For we cannot do anything against the truth, but only for the truth.

verses.zh: 即使我们软弱，你们刚强，我们也欢喜；并且我们所求的，就是你们作完全人。
verses.en: We are glad whenever we are weak but you are strong; and our prayer is that you may be fully restored.

verses.zh: 所以，我不在你们那里的时候，把这话写给你们，好叫我见你们的时候，不用照主所给我的权柄严厉的待你们。这权柄原是为造就人，并不是为败坏人。
verses.en: This is why I write these things when I am absent, that when I come I may not have to be harsh in my use of authority—the authority the Lord gave me for building you up, not tearing you down.

verses.zh: 还有末了的话：愿弟兄们都喜乐。要作完全人；要受安慰；要同心合意；要彼此和睦。如此仁爱和平的神必常与你们同在。
verses.en: Finally, brothers and sisters, rejoice! Strive for full restoration, encourage one another, be of one mind, live in peace. And the God of love and peace will be with you.

verses.zh: 你们亲嘴问安，彼此务要圣洁。
verses.en: Greet one another with a holy kiss.

verses.zh: 众圣徒都问你们安。
verses.en: All God’s people here send their greetings.

verses.zh: 愿主耶稣基督的恩惠、神的慈爱、圣灵的感动，常与你们众人同在！
verses.en: May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.
